examples: It might be less draughty if the door were closed.
All the shops were closed, so we couldn't buy any food.

body_content.explanation: finished and therefore not able to be discussed any more :
examples: "The matter is closed," said the headteacher.

body_content.explanation: not wanting to accept new ideas, people, customs, etc.:
examples: You have such a closed mind.
The setting of the novel is the closed world of banking.

body_content.explanation: A closed question can be answered with "yes" or "no" or by choosing one of a number of fixed answers:
examples: The salesperson asks a closed question, "Shall I reserve one for you?", implying a yes or no answer.
The researchers prepare a list of questions, which may be closed or open-ended.
